object.name: TextQuote
object.description: This object contains information about the quoted part of a message that is replied to by the given message.
object.html_description: This object contains information about the quoted part of a message that is replied to by the given message.
object.rst_description: This object contains information about the quoted part of a message that is replied to by the given message.

annotations.description: Text of the quoted part of a message that is replied to by the given message
annotations.html_description: Text of the quoted part of a message that is replied to by the given message
annotations.rst_description: Text of the quoted part of a message that is replied to by the given message
annotations.name: text

annotations.description: Special entities that appear in the quote. Currently, only bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, spoiler, and custom_emoji entities are kept in quotes.
annotations.html_description: Optional. Special entities that appear in the quote. Currently, only bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, spoiler, and custom_emoji entities are kept in quotes.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Special entities that appear in the quote. Currently, only *bold*, *italic*, *underline*, *strikethrough*, *spoiler*, and *custom_emoji* entities are kept in quotes.
annotations.name: entities

annotations.description: Approximate quote position in the original message in UTF-16 code units as specified by the sender
annotations.html_description: Approximate quote position in the original message in UTF-16 code units as specified by the sender
annotations.rst_description: Approximate quote position in the original message in UTF-16 code units as specified by the sender
annotations.name: position

annotations.description: True, if the quote was chosen manually by the message sender. Otherwise, the quote was added automatically by the server.
annotations.html_description: Optional. True, if the quote was chosen manually by the message sender. Otherwise, the quote was added automatically by the server.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. :code:`True`, if the quote was chosen manually by the message sender. Otherwise, the quote was added automatically by the server.
annotations.name: is_manual
